subsection.name: Target
subsection.p: Anyone can translate Jajuk, no computer science is required. Note this is a volontary work. For any question or comments, please send me a mail : bertrand@florat.net. Translate current Jajuk version takes approximately 3 hours.

subsection.name: README file translation
subsection.p: The README file is displayed during installation and is on the web site. Its name is README_${iso3 code on 3 letters}.html. Get README file of your choice as a source language. Example: use README.html as english source language at http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/jajuk/jajuk/dist-files/doc/README.html or any other README file in the directory and translate it. List of ISO3 codes is available at : http://ftp.ics.uci.edu/pub/ietf/http/related/iso3166.txt.

subsection.name: Jajuk translation
subsection.p: Jajuk uses the standard Java internationalization (i18n) system based on properties file. Files are:

${locale} is a ISO language code, see http://www.ics.uci.edu/pub/ietf/http/related/iso639.txt. jajuk.properties contains default resource bundle (English) and you have a property file for each language.

li.p: Get property file of your choice as a source language. Example: use jajuk.properties as English source language at http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/jajuk/jajuk/src/org/jajuk/i18n/jajuk.properties or any other property file in the directory.
Your file should begin with :

FROM comment gives exact CVS version you translated to allow diffs with newer versions and Revision gives automatically the current CVS version of your file ( do not change this line manually, it will be updated by CVS).
Look at file structure: It is a simple key=value format. Example:

p.span:
ParameterView.73=Check this if you allow others people to come read music from your box
ParameterView.74=Password :
ParameterView.75=Set password access to your box. If no password is set, no one can read from it

li.p: Simply translate each value, Previous example in French:

p.span:
ParameterView.73=Accepter que d'autres utilisateurs lise la musique situ�e sur votre machine
ParameterView.74=Mot de passe :
ParameterView.75=Fixez un mot de passe � votre machine. Tant que le mot de passe n'est pas fix�, personne ne peut s'y connecter

li.p: Translate even lines like Language_desc_*=* (other languages names) and add a new line with your own language name.

Send me ( bertrand@florat.net) your work as a property file with your local ( ex: jajuk_ru.properties for russian ). It could be nice you send also a message in the forum: http://sourceforge.net/forum/forum.php?forum_id=315360. Contact me if you have a developer profile so I will create a CVS account for you. Then you will be able to commit and maintain your translation files directly in the repository.
(Optional) If you want to test your work (ant must be installed):
Edit ${jajuk installation path}/src/org/jajuk/Main.java file.and search for line :

ul.p: Add after this line your own local. Example :

li.p: Copy your properties file in the ${jajuk installation path}/src/org/jajuk/i18n directory
Go in the ${jajuk installation path} directory where you can find the build.xml file
Rebuild Jajuk typing 'ant'
Launch Jajuk and set language in the parameter view of the configuration perspective.
Check your work.

subsection.name: Translation upgrades
subsection.p: As you can imagine, Jajuk evolves and new releases brings new labels or modify them. Before new releases, the packager will send a message to all translators in order to upgrade their translation. Note that if some new labels are not translated, they will simply be displayed in English and so, a missing translation is not critical. The hard work is the first translation : upgrade a translation requires only few minutes. You can upgrade your translation whenever you want. What you have to do when upgrading a translation is :

li.p: If your source (FROM) language is NOT English, make sure it is up to date before upgrading it.
Check your #FROM comment at the beginning of your file, it should contain CVS release version of your last upgrade.

Perform a 'diff' between this release and the latest in CVS repository. To achieve that, you can either use ViewCVS interface accessible from Jajuk web site (CVS Web repository) or a CVS client like Eclipse if you have one.
Remove old labels, modify and add new ones.
Upgrade the #FROM comment with the translated release.
Commit your file or send it by mail.
Off course, do not modify keys but only values.
If a value contains a '\ ', do not drop it, it means there is a space at line start or end.
Keep all punctuation and specials characters like '[','.' and so on...
Set date format according your locale, ex: DD/MM/YYYY in French, YYYY-MM-DD in English
Try to keep values length near from source ones so labels will not be too long and stay visible.
Use a spelling corrector.
